_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Wayne Farms LLC-Dobson is a poultry processing facility that stores and uses ammonia, which is regulated by EPA's Risk Management Program.

Wayne Farms LLC-Dobson's chemical storage and handling facilities:
1.  are properly designed
2.  have effective operation and maintenance procedures
3.  employ trained operators and tecchnicians
4.  periodically conduct safety audits, and
5.  are constantly upgrading its processes to meet or exceed industry standards

Wayne Farms LLC-Dobson also has taken a proactive approach towards coordinating emergency efforts with the Dobson Fire Department.  The Surry County E.M.A. has a copy of our emergency response program and is well trained and prepared to respond to the potential spills and leaks that may occur at the Wayne Farms LLC-Dobson facility.  The Fire Department conducts annual site visits to our facility and is prepared to respond to a possible spill or leak.

A facility which maintains high standards, such as Wayne Farms LLC-Dobson, provides less public risk than a facility that does not provide safe operations.  Wayne Farms LLC-Dobson complies with all Federal OSHA rules and guidelines.  We also utilize outside experts to periodically inspect our systems integrity, train system operators, and upgrade system to imporve safety.  Wayne Farms - Dobson has no reportable releases of ammonia dirung he past five years.

Wayne Farms believes the ammonia we store and handle on site has a very real and potential danger.  Wayne Farms LLC-Dobson used EPA's OCA Guidance for off-site consequence analysis of ammonia.

CONCLUSION
Wayne Farms LLC believes that the poultry industry should proactively inform the public of the potential dangers and the actions that Wayne Farms LLC has taken to minimize these dangers.  Wayne Farms LLC-Dobson (one of the larger employers in Surry County) has a long-great ongoing relationship with the community.  We encourage any and all citizens who have concerns or questions to contact our facility.  We look f
orward to continuing our relationship in Surry County.
